text: umm, have you played through the entire game and have you seen all of the puzzles involved? I'm definitely not a pretentious hipster, but i enjoy the game a lot. Go ahead and hate, because that seems to be the trend these days; hate on anything different. I love big name titles such as Darksiders 2, Fallout, and even the GoW series. I also love Fez, Super Meat Boy, Outland, Limbo, and other XBLA titles. A good game is a good game, regardless of graphics...btw, the art was amazing in the game.
author: T Lee

text: Let me join the club and kiss your ass, sir.  I agree almost entirely.  I admittedly do enjoy CoD and other competitive shooters I think that they're generally well balanced and it's your pure skill vs your opponent's as opposed to item based games like WoW.  Playing with other people online competitively is a lot of fun, it's hard to knock that.  But I also love Fez it offers a degree of beauty, creativity, innovation, and art I'll probably never find in a competitive shooter.  Fuck EA

author: Quade Zaban

text:
1) Yeah, it is focusing on online play.  2) Since AFAIK it never offered 4 player split screen.  3) Um, yeah, maybe you missed all the great 4-player FPS games like Goldeneye, Perfect Dark, TimeSplitters, and Halo.  4) I couldn't tell you what Battlefield focuses on other than realistic graphics & guns.

I don't like Battlefield or CoD because I find military shooters to be boring.  Being thrown into a war wouldn't be fun at all, so I can't fathom why people think it makes for a fun videogame.
author: N1xZer0

text:
COD is focusing on Online Play? o_O Since when? Did I missed anything? And Battlefield is focusing on great epic single player campaigns, right? 

o______O
author: Justforvisit

text:
Claiming that Fez uses a "gimic, with bad art direction and mediocre graphics" sounds pretty biased.  The game's graphics and "gimic" are both tied to the story, which is based on a book called "Flatland".  The music and art direction are key to the game's mood, and again, go hand-in-hand with the story and gameplay.

I've put more time into Super Meat Boy, Braid, Limbo, and Fez than any big retail release, and not because I was trying to look hip, but because they were the most fun to play.
author: N1xZer0

text:
Agreed.  People don't hate COD to be hipsters.  I hate it because it's focus is online play, and it attracts a lot of kids and hillbilly alpha males. Goldeneye was super popular and I loved it to death.  However, I thought that the move to bigger, hi-def displays and ridiculous amounts of processing power would IMPROVE 4-player split screen games, not kill them off.  I like playing games with friends, not random potty-mouthed 13-year-olds and drunk gun nuts.

CoD just isn't fun, but Fez is.

author: HyMyNameIsMatt

text:
Whoa, all this hate. :<
Don't hate something because it's popular. Even better: don't hate things unless they're blatantly offensive. You can share an opinion without making it so strong.
I love video games in general, I think they have great potential, and the music is one of my favorite parts of playing these games - a position that is only strengthened by the wonderful work done on the Fez soundtrack.
:3
author: Kasran Fox

text: Haha, wow, is this a top comment now? I wrote that a while ago and it's not my best piece, I admit. But I think you missed my main point: "Big companies like Activision and EA release the same generic shit over and over again". It's not entirely the people that play them, it's the games themselves. I don't call people sheep, that's silly: I call them stupid because they're playing the same game over and over, released with a bit of extra content. Oh, and btw: it wasn't a story. Sheep.

author: kdreamland

text: Well I'm from the Uk. And if Phil Fish said "There's no such thing as a good UK games developer of a good UK video game" I'd feel strongly inclined to disagree with him. Strongly inclined. And if you think the same way, I'm going to disagree with you as well. Seriously, he makes FEZ and all of a sudden I guess he's created a game better than any Japanese Developer ever. He needs to get over himself.
author: kdreamland

text: Rotate the world when you run out of things to jump onto. When you fall, you don't go to the start of the room, you go to the platform you last jumped from. Where's the risk? There is none. Riveting gameplay right there (which games like SPM and Crush have already attempted). There's no enemies, or obstacles. Older games these "retro" indie titles are trying to replicate were challenging, filled with creative ideas, and pushed the original hardware to its limits. Fez does none of this.

text:
90% of the people who think Phil Fish is a total dick for what he said about Japanese games said far worse things about the developers of Mass Effect 3's ending, no doubt.

author: Oblivionatingstud

text:
I honestly don't see the problem with Fish's comments on Japanese developers. If he was in the film industry commenting on Hollywood, he would not have received this knee-jerk reaction from the media. He's an independent developer: of course he hates the major developers. In my opinion, people like him make the critical statements that are all too often absent from the discourse on media production. 

Also, props to SupraDarky for his support for this great game.

author: Mace Stampede

text: People hating on the game for the developers opinion on the gaming industry just stress his point. When he says gamers are the worst people, he's right (in a way). Just look at how demanding some people are of developers these days. Gamers demand very high (often unreasonably high) standards for games, be it graphics-wise, multiplayer-wise, or related to content abundancy. Especially for Indie Developers (like Phil), it's almost impossible to get every aspect of a game to reach the set bar.
